# Joy in the Making

| last_aired        = 1946
| website            =
| podcast            =
}}
Joy in the Making is a 1945 Australian radio series for children by Edmund Barclay and Joy Hollyer. It was a series of dramas based on historical events.
The ABC Weekly, reviewing the first episode, said:
Our chief criticism is that this might be a little too advanced listening for young children. The much older children and their fathers (and perhaps mothers) will like it more; Beautifully scripted, and opening with the splendidly quoted lines, “I too will something make, and joy in the making,” the half-hour play had barely a weak link... The whole thing was inspirational  as well as educational... Don’t miss Joy in the Making.

*Ep 1 - Four Men and a Light, the story of the attempts to build the Eddystone Lighthouse (30 Sept)
*Ep 2 - Elizabeth Pry (7 Oct)
